citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
* The itinerary submitted into the Region Office just listed the address of the CHI Health Center, in Omaha, Ne., as the
place of exhibition. The Dates listed were 2/28/25 to 3/2/25, for the event. The itinerary did not include any layovers,
exhibition sites and leaving and or returning to the home site. As of the date of inspection no other updated itinerary had
been provided to APHIS Officials. Without certainty of the names, dates, locations and or any stops and layovers that
allow that allow the removal of animals from their enclosures listed on the itinerary, does not allow for APHIS officials to
conduct and home or traveling inspection. This can potentially affect the inspection of the welfare for the 14 dogs.
For required inspection purposes and to allow APHIS Officials to ensure the welfare of the animals, all written itineraries
must include the dates from leaving and returning to the home site, and names, dates, locations for stops and layovers
that allow or require the removal of the animals from their enclosures to the Deputy Administrator no fewer than two days.
For future and the current layover and stops a complete itinerary must be sent into the office.
To be corrected by, 12-March-2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.126(c)(1)(iii) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
* The itinerary submitted into the Region Office just listed the address of the CHI Health Center, in Omaha, Ne., as the 
place of exhibition. The Dates listed were 2/28/25 to 3/2/25, for the event. The itinerary did not include any layovers, 
exhibition sites and leaving and or returning to the home site. As of the date of inspection no other updated itinerary had 
been provided to APHIS Officials. Without certainty of the names, dates, locations and or any stops and layovers that 
allow that allow the removal of animals from their enclosures listed on the itinerary, does not allow for APHIS officials to 
conduct and home or traveling inspection. This can potentially affect the inspection of the welfare for the 14 dogs.  
 
For required inspection purposes and to allow APHIS Officials to ensure the welfare of the animals, all written itineraries 
must include the dates from leaving and returning to the home site, and names, dates, locations for stops and layovers 
that allow or require the removal of the animals from their enclosures to the Deputy Administrator no fewer than two days. 
For future and the current layover and stops a complete itinerary must be sent into the office. 
 
To be corrected by, 12-March-2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
